item.title: Same inputs, same xz version, different platforms, WILDLY different result sizes
item.description:
Facepalm on me: please disregard the above post. It didn't occur to me that xz might have gzip-like options for controlling the compression level, especially since tar's invocation of the xz binary does not add any (and thus it's presumably using the defaults, though it's demonstrably not).

In any case: once i found the -# compression option flags i found i could squeeze it down to 1.5MB reliably on both platforms.

My appologies for the noise!
item.dc:creator: stephan beal
